info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 20 at 5:03AM AKST until December 21 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow, some mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches. Highest amounts are expected across the Anchorage and Eagle River Hillsides and along the Glenn Highway. * WHERE...Anchorage. * WHEN...From 6 AM Monday to 1 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. Expect reductions in visibility to as low as one mile. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow will develop across the Anchorage Bowl Monday morning. The snow may mix with sleet and freezing rain initially, especially over West Anchorage, as warmer air moves in aloft. Any mixed precipitation will changeover to all snow Monday afternoon as colder air moves back over the region. Snowfall rates are expected to increase late Monday afternoon and evening in conjunction with the cold air advection. Snowfall rates during this time could approach one inch per hour, especially over favored upslope areas such as along the Glenn Highway and the Anchorage and Eagle River Hillsides. Visibility along area roads, especially the Glenn Highway, could be severely reduced if the heavier snow rates occur during the evening commute due to resuspended snow in the wake of vehicle traffic. The snow is expected to taper off by early Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
